body.name: LG 28MQ750-C 28 Inch SDQHD (2560 x 2880) Nano IPS DualUp Monitor with Tilt/Height/Swivel Stand, DCI-P3 98% (Typ.) HDR10, USB Type-C (90W PD) - Black

features: 28" SDQHD (2560 x 2880) Nano IPS Display with a 100Hz Refresh Rate- Explore HDR content the way it was meant to be seen with DCI-P3 98%—an elevated color spectrum that brings brilliant color to life
USB Type-C (90W PD) - Seamlessly connect to external devices or charge your laptop with the convenience of USB Type-C with up to 90W power delivery.

Ambient Light Sensor with Auto Brightness - The ambient light sensor makes the screen brighter in bright lighting conditions and decreases the brightness in darker lighting conditions so it is always easy to view information.

One Source Picture by Picture - By connecting your laptop to the LG DualUp monitor via the HDMI DisplayPort and USB Type C, you can easily control both displays without using software or shortcut keys.

Built-in Keyboard, Video Monitor and Mouse (KVM) - With the PBP feature you can display content from two different computers on the monitor and use the KVM feature to manage the content with a single keyboard and mouse.
Stack It Up - Free up desk space and multitask more efficiently with a new, 16:18 aspect ratio stacked setup that swivels, freeing up your desk without giving up the screen space of a double monitor.

Feel Better, Work Better - Ideal for programmers, content creators, and even for a work from home setup, the LG DualUp Monitor helps boost productivity by creating a flexible workstation for better, more comfortable posture.
Ergonomic Design - The ergonomic stand makes it easy to flexibly adjust the height, tilt, and swivel of the screen in the optimal position for you. Tilt: -5~25° Swivel: ±30° Height: 80mm

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Stack It Up Free up desk space and multitask more efficiently with a new, 16:18 aspect ratio stacked setup that swivels, freeing up your desk without giving up the screen space of a double monitor. Enhance your efficiency with a new format of 16:18 aspect ratio SDQHD display.

Ambient Light Sensor with Auto Brightness The ambient light sensor makes the screen brighter in bright lighting conditions and decreases the brightness in darker lighting conditions so it is always easy to view information.

One Source Picture by Picture By connecting your laptop to the LG DualUp monitor via the HDMI DisplayPort and USB Type C, you can easily control both displays without using software or shortcut keys.* *DisplayPort cable not included. Built-in Keyboard, Video Monitor and Mouse (KVM) With the PBP feature you can display content from two different computers on the monitor and use the KVM feature to manage the content with a single keyboard and mouse.
SDQHD Nano IPS Display Explore HDR content the way it was meant to be seen with DCI-P3 98%**—an elevated color spectrum that brings brilliant color to life. *DCI-P3 Typical 98%, Minimum 90%
Versatile Connectivity Seamlessly connect to external devices or charge your laptop with the convenience of USB Type-C with up to 90W power delivery.

Feel Better, Work Better Ideal for programmers, content creators, and even for a work from home setup, the LG DualUp Monitor helps boost productivity by creating a flexible workstation for better, more comfortable posture.
Ergonomic Design The ergonomic stand makes it easy to flexibly adjust the height, tilt, and swivel of the screen in the optimal position for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I have two for my workstation, absolutely love these monitors!
reviews.reviewText: I recently received a new Macbook Pro M3 Pro laptop from work (replacing an Intel Macbook Pro whose lease was up), and had a couple of older LCD monitors that needed to be replaced. After doing some research on features I decided to replace the LCD monitors with two of these babies.I mounted them on retractable arms to clear desk space, and set them into full screen mode as the work laptop only supports two external monitors (my personal Macbook, also new, is an M3 Max and supports 4). The monitors as well as a couple of other devices are hooked up to a CalDigit TS4 Thunderbolt 4 Dock, and the Macbook is hooked to the Dock with a single Thunderbolt 4 cable, which provides access to all devices as well as power the laptop via the CalDigit dock.I do want to mention that I am a software engineer, and write code for a living, so having high quality monitors to save my poor tired eyes is a must.I am loving this setup! I keep Slack open on my Laptop screen, keep two web browsers open on one monitor and my IDE in full screen mode on the other. The eye fatigue is all but gone, which is awesome, the monitors are cool and don't put off alot of heat (which was not the case with the ones I have retired), and all of the cable are now gone off my desktop.(A side node, the Macbook Pro M3 Pro is ULTRA QUIET, I don't think I've heard the fans kick in a single time since I set all this up).Having the monitors on the retractable arms not only frees up desk space, it allows me to adjust the monitors so that they are conducive to coding and switching focus from the IDE to the browsers and back without alot of extra motion.Did I mention that the resolution is fantastic? It is.I have also put them in dual screen mode hooked up to my personal Macbook Pro, and that works well, switching between modes is super easy. The monitor with the browsers I put in dual screen mode but the one that displays my IDE I keep as a single screen.Highly recommend, worth the investment, this set up should do me for a few years to come, and my eyes are thanking me!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Programmer. Tall is great.Not the smallest pixels on the planet, smaller than my eyes resolve, so good enough.If you use progressive lens bifocals, you may not be happy. I have a set of single vision lenses made at my computer distance and use those.Come on quickly, doesn't do stupid things. Audio is, let's say "usable". Good enough for beeps and alerts, and if I want music or a longer educational video I switch up to something more expensive than the whole monitor anyway. Comes with all the cables you might need! That's refreshing these days.I think this review is on the one that sits on a stand. I also got the one with the clamp on swivel arm which is slightly more expensive, but that arm is a work of art! It just couldn't be attached to my one desk. You will need about 3" of overhang to clamp the clamp. But like I said, this is the one with a more traditional stand and it is fabulous too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great tall monitor for vertical content
reviews.reviewText: I was able to grab one of these during a good pre-Christmas sale, but have been interested in this model for awhile. LG makes quality products, and this monitor is no exception. The picture quality is great and bright, and it is the equivalent of two 1440p monitors stacked on top of each other vertically. I also plan to make use of the Picture by Picture (PBP) capability that will present the HDMI1 in the top half of the screen and HDMI2 in the bottom have the screen, thereby granting a full 1440p monitor to two different computers simultaneously. Otherwise, I can allocate the full monitor resolution to either computer, as desired.I spent a week teleworking with this new monitor and I found it very useful for working with tall formatted content such as documents and software code. I also work with two ulta wide 1440p monitors, where I tile my work across the screen horizontally. This requires me to swing my head from side to side or turn my whole body to go from one end to the other. I will just need to adjust my working habits more to stack things more vertically to reduce turning of my head sideways. The only annoyance I have encountered so far is that Windows has shortcuts to snap windows to the left and right halves of the screen, but have not found a way to snap them to the top and bottom halves of the screen yet. This can be done by manually resizing windows top and bottom, but this does slow down productivity a bit. But being able to fit most classes within a single screen without scrolling is a huge win for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Awesome Monitor, Limited Stand
reviews.reviewText: This monitor is legit, with the size and dual screen its a perfect fit for my desk. The only issue I'm having is with the stand. The movement is limited. I would just buy a different stand for the monitor.
La resolución es muy buena y puede que la densidad de píxeles sea muy alta para el tamaño en realidad, es como tener 2 monitores de 21 a 144px

reviews.reviewTitle: Excelente monitor, pero no apto para PS5
reviews.reviewText: Este es un excelente monitor para casi todas las tareas, si eres programador lo vas a amar, mas sin embargo si lo quieres para gaming con una PS5, no te recomendaria que lo compraras ya que la gama de color es malisima, incluso estando en la pantalla de inicio, los colores no se pueden ajustar y se ven pesimos en comparacion a una TV, fuera de eso es estupendo para las tareas cotidianas, mas sin embargo para la proxima vez me compraria un monitor curvo.

I use this on my work laptop and my M2 Mac mini.Resolution issues that were previously stated looks like they’re fixed, I’m able to use both this monitor (2560*2880) and a 4K at the same time on native resolution.This monitor allows me to:1. See more code than I normally could even compared to my 4K2. Use my work computer with dual monitor and still use my Mac on the top part of the screen (or bottom if you want) and vice versa3. Have my work computer on the bottom, video game console on the top and Mac on my other monitor at the same time for those lazy days.Only thing I’d say to watch for is to make sure your laptop has a dedicated video card. My work laptop doesn’t and it barely runs both monitors and the hugest frame rate I can get out of it is 30(yuck) but that’s not a problem with the monitor itself.I also accidentally bought the one without the ergo arm, so watch out for that

Great for coding and research, decent for content consumption and gaming if you don't mind the frame size in the portrait aspect ratio.The monitor is not for competitive or immersive gameplay, but casual or story games it gets the job done with flying colors (pun intended, the colors are amazing out of the box). The double simultaneous inputs from 2 devices work like a marvel as well.The arm is solid, feels great and effortless, though it doesn't go as high as I'd like, but nothing a piece if wood can't fix.I went from having 3 screens to 1 and I don't mind at all. Just make sure that if you're on windows, to use fancy zones for a more optimal multitasking environment.

reviews.reviewTitle: LG DualUp is a perfect companion monitor to 42" OLED displays
reviews.reviewText: LG DualUp's unique form factor pairs with 42 inch displays for a perfect triple monitor setup.The ASUS PG42UQ (uses an LG C2 OLED panel) has the same screen height, same matte coating, matching borders and both share the same resolution scale on mac. Moving windows between screens feels exactly the same size and dpi:- The LGs are set to 1440p at 2x dpi, both connected with the 1m+ provided usb-c cables. One of them powers my Macbook by USB-C (96W). The DualUp also acts as KVM so when I switch to the PC input my logitech unifying dongle and usb headset auto switches computers.- The ASUS is set to 1440p at 1.5x dpi (Mac OS renders it to 5K then scales it down by half so it looks sharp on 4K).- I combined all monitors in Mac OS midi to create a multi-output sound device, sounds amazing for general purpose.- LGs color temperature adjust with the OS night time settings, automatic brightness works well, and colors look great out of the box.*My computers:- Macbook Pro 14 (M1 Max)- Windows PC (3080Ti)
